vehicles.description: A silver van is positioned in front of our vehicle, traveling in the same direction.
vehicles.explanation: The size and position of the van may obstruct the view of the road ahead from this car, so this car should maintain a safe following distance.

vehicles.description: Several vehicles were parked on the right side of the road, with some partially on the sidewalk.
vehicles.explanation: These vehicles reduce the available width of the road, requiring the main vehicle to drive carefully to avoid side scraping.

vulnerable_road_users.description: Several construction workers wearing high-visibility vests can be seen on the right side of the road.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: They are close to the road and may move suddenly, so be careful and be prepared to stop or slow down.

traffic cones.description: Red and white traffic cones have been placed on the right side of the road, indicating that there is some kind of road construction or lane closure ahead.
traffic cones.explanation: These cone markers indicate that the vehicle should keep to the right and be alert for possible movement of workers or construction equipment.

barriers.description: Metal guardrails are installed on the left side of the road, used to separate opposing lanes or different sections of the road.
barriers.explanation: This obstacle limits the options for the vehicle's lateral maneuvers and enforces the requirement to remain in the current lane.

other objects.description: There is a green bicycle leaning against a metal railing on the left, but there is no cyclist.
other objects.explanation: Although bicycles themselves do not directly pose a risk, they suggest that the area may have activities that need to be monitored.

general_perception.description and explanation:
The traffic image reveals the presence of several road users and objects. In front of our vehicle, there is a silver van traveling in the same direction, which may obstruct our view of the road ahead, necessitating a safe following distance. Additionally, several vehicles are parked on the right side of the road, some of which encroach onto the sidewalk, thus narrowing the road and requiring cautious driving to avoid side scraping.

On the right side of the road, several construction workers wearing high-visibility vests are seen. Their proximity to the road and potential for sudden movement necessitates careful driving and readiness to stop or slow down.

Red and white traffic cones are arrayed on the right side, indicating road construction or a lane closure ahead. These cones urge the vehicle to stay to the right and remain alert for any worker or equipment movement.

Metal guardrails on the left side separate opposing lanes or road sections, restricting lateral movement options and compelling the vehicle to stay in its current lane.

Lastly, a green bicycle is leaning against a metal railing on the left, without a nearby cyclist. While the bicycle itself is not a direct hazard, its presence signals potential activities in the area that should be monitored.

driving_suggestion: When driving your own vehicle, it's important to maintain a safe distance from the delivery van in front, always be ready to stop, and carefully navigate lanes narrowed due to parked vehicles and road construction. You should also reduce speed on wet and slippery roads to prevent hydroplaning and ensure the safety of all road users. Be vigilant for workers who may be near the roadside, and be ready to adjust your position to avoid traffic cones while also respecting the metal barriers on the left. With wet road surfaces, exercise caution while driving, stay alert, and look out for any other road users or obstacles that may emerge from either side of the road.

1.description and explanation: This object is a manually powered two-wheel vehicle commonly used for transportation, recreation, or sport. In the context of driving, encountering this vehicle on the road usually requires the driver to be cautious and to maintain a safe distance to ensure the safety of the rider, as they are more vulnerable than those in motor vehicles.

2.description and explanation: This object appears to be a safety device often used to create temporary traffic patterns or to alert motorists of road work or other hazards. Drivers should slow down and prepare for potential changes in traffic flow or lane narrowing when they see this object.

3.description and explanation: The individual identified here is a person walking along the side of or near the roadway. Drivers must be vigilant for the potential of a pedestrian entering the roadway and should be prepared to slow down or stop if necessary to ensure their safety, particularly in regions where pedestrian traffic is common or expected.

4.description and explanation: Similar to object 3, this is another person walking. The presence of such individuals near the roadway indicates an area where high alertness is essential, as pedestrians might cross or walk along the road, creating a need for potential adjustments to speed or lane position to increase safety margins.

5.description and explanation: A traffic cone is visible, typically used to signal caution, redirect traffic, or mark an area of construction or an obstruction on the road. As the ego car approaches, the driver should slow down and prepare to maneuver around the cone, while also being alert for potential roadwork or hazards ahead.
